comment: pretty easy class (i had it online). there was a discussion post due every week and then a paper due about an art piece from a museum. not a ton of feedback, but she has a very clear rubric; typical easy a class

Although this was one of the easiest classes I have taken, Professor Bell was not the best professor. The only time she would reach out is if you initiated the conversation. Got a high A in the class but could not tell you a single thing I learned in this class.

I loved Professor Bell's online class! She is easy to get in touch with should the need ever arise, and she is very kind in grading. Her expectations are clear, and the material is fun to learn! Grades come from participating in 8 out of 11 weekly discussion boards, taking 3 tests, and writing an analysis of a museum exhibit. I'd 100% take again!

Take her online and it's an easy A! You need to complete 8 out of 11 dposts thorught the semester, but she grades them mercifully. She understands that this is only an intro class. Test questions are on quizlet, and one paper about a museum analysis. Dream intro professor:)

You had to do 8 out of I think 11 discussion posts, which was not bad. There were four tests to do (no lockdown), and they were pretty easy if you did the reading for the week. Overall, a pretty easy class to take.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class was pretty easy and she would send out reminders each week so you would remember to finish and turn in your work. You have to write at least 8 discussions throughout the class but she gives you more so you're allowed to skip some and still be fine. Tests are a little hard but still relatively easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Be on time! Attendance is imporant! She gives daily assignments and if you miss them you will get a 0%. Shes a picky grader but its a great thing so one can get pushed and get out of confort zone. Show up on time, and do assignments & projects and you will get an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Her online class is super easy. Only 4 discussions you have to participate on. 3 easy tests, answers all online (quizlet). Also a paper that was 2 pages long because there was a number count for each paragraph. If you get anything less than an A then that means you didnt do anything.

This was an easy online course to take with a heavy load from other classes. There were 4 online discussions (100 words each) super easy. You have a few tests. While the study guide didn't help, google did. wink wink. There is one paper, it was not difficult to write. I recommend taking this coarse to fulfill your humanities prereq requirement.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great to take for online art. Very flexible schedule. There are discussion posts each week you only have to do FOUR over the course of the semester. There are a couple exams they are not hard. They come from the book. I didn't get the book just used others quizlet cards to study and I aced the first exam.
Pretty straightforward and easy. Only readings are in text. 3 exams, one paper on a museum exhibit, and 4 discussion posts. Nothing overwhelming.
Took this class online, pretty easy A. 3 tests, a museum visit, and 4 discussion board posts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: There are 4 tests and 1 writing assignment from a trip to an art exhibit.  The book is expensive, even to rent, so I didn't get it.  I was able to pass the tests using the cengage online study guide.  Will have to do 4 discussions throughout the course for credit, pretty easy, 100 words each.

After reading all of Prof. Bell's rates I was nervous after I registerd for her class but after actually being in it it isn't as bad as most people say. You definitely need to study for her tests but the tests aren't insnaley hard. The questions are actually basic informatioin you would easily be able to answer if you read the book.
Easy ARt class.  Take her.
If you do the assignments and read the book, you have no problem getting an A.  I thought it was an easy A.  Don't expect to not read and get an A though.

If you like listening to someone read poorly made PowerPoints this class is for you. It is not a difficult course, but because of her random in-class assignments, you need to show up. I've never had so much trouble not falling asleep. My dislike of the subject did not help. In class it seems like she doesn't want to be there.

Professor Bell is a really good person, she is little tough at grading but really helpful. Her test are tough, so you have to study from power point and text book as well. She take one group presentation of 5 min but you need to be well prepared. I got A in her class... She is bad at replying to emails so ask everything before class end.

BORING. 90% of the time she reads from the slides word for word. Attendance is not mandatory, but there are random in class assignments. The tests are projected on the screen from a powerpoint and are difficult to take. STUDY or you will fail, simple as that. There is extra credit, but it wont help much if you don't do well. I love art, but no.

She's a very sweet woman but yes, her class is as boring as it gets. Power points every class and she will do "pop" assignments, so try to have good attendance. She'll give you study guides and post her PPTs before tests, if you look over it or read, you will make a B or an A. Anyone saying her tests are hard just didn't put forth any effort.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! Awful professor. All she does is read off her power point slides and is very boring. Tests are hard and she will not email you back. Bad at communication and teaching. Worst class I have ever taken.

Mrs. Bell is quiet and sweet. I don't know why all these people say she isn't helpful. She goes over all projects in class and posts all project instructions online AND she one on one discusses your project progress with you almost daily. You have to earn your A. Try hard, everything in life can't be handed to you. It's your education, it matters!

She's a nice person, but the class is difficult. Her study guides are too broad. You have to give a 2-3 minute presentation I got a B after following the guidelines to a "T". She gets upset because b/c maybe 20/90 kids go to class, so she gives tons of extra credit. Go to class!! B/c of extra credit my final grade went up 5 points

Class was rather dull. Prof was lifeless. Occasional interesting videos. Powerpoint presentations by teacher daily. This year, every student in the 90 seat class presented a 3 minute powerpoint; these take up half the classes for most of the year and are usually not very interesting. Not hard to make an A. Would not really recommend.

Class is her powerpoints. She doesn't take attendance but if you miss a day you are likely to miss out on chapter notes. Three Tests, Three writing assignments (two of which in class) and a presentation. A couple chances for EC but don't depend on it. Overall, good teacher

Mrs. Bell knows what she's doing and has always been very helpful. She makes sure each of her students are on the right track with projects. do not slack, be late, miss class. Her humor is dry but she's a great instructor. If you do the work to the best of your ability and she knows that you tried, there's no way you won't get  a good grade. try!

I really liked Mrs. Bell. She's quiet but she's friendly. Her projects are fun and beneficial. She posts all project requirements online, as well as discussing them in class. She lets you know if you're on the right track with a project. Study the power-point papers you fill out in class, there's always a quiz next class! Work hard & you'll be ok.

She isn't exactly mean or hard, just very boring. She has a monotoned voice and reads directly from the powerpoints. The tests are kind of difficult, and the study guides are far too vague to help. Over all there are not many assignments, but you have to actually try and study hard if you want an A. Avoid if possible.

She lacks personality, and grades unfairly. In her power point lectures, she reads directly from the screen and during critiques she gives out sheets for you to go by. Very boring, and the critiques weren't helpful. She likes cliche work, and isn't open to what you like. She won't point things out in class that she takes points off for later.

You won't really know what your grade is until the end of the semester. It's boring, but most of the assignments will help you in one way or another. If she cancels class or we get behind, she doesn't cut out any projects... they just get moved further to the end of the semester. Then you get overwhelmed. This should really be an online class!

The class is fine.  It was actually pretty fun even though some of the projects felt ridiculous.  She's a little ambiguous.  She will tell you to do one thing on a project and then she will grade against it.  She's hard to read and even harder to understand sometimes.  Okay teacher...

She was very nice, but very strict. Does not like it when you come to class unprepared. She is a very good professor if you actually want to learn something and she does make you learn photoshop for certain projects!
what is happening in the visual arts program? how did she get in????????????
The class is a waste especially with her. She thinks she is so arty she can't get over herself. She is married to Mr. "So-Arty-I-Can't-Get-Over-Myself" in Photo 3400.
